abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and the institutional development
            impact substantial. Positive lessons point at the critical
            Bank's advisory role to the United Nations Interim
            Administration in Kosovo (UNMIK), financing and guiding
            other donors, and particularly important in the provision of
            budget support, and assessment of the budget. Likewise,
            ownership by the authorities, and selectivity in
            conditionality was important for the success of the project,
            as the Bank, and UNMIK concentrated on policy matters for
            immediate recovery, laying the foundation for long-term
            sustainability, i.e., initiation of public finance, the
            banking system, and trade flows. However, the Bank has
            highlighted that the technical details of the operation,
            need further careful negotiation when the authority is
            segmented, and also outlines both the flexibility provided
            by single-tranche operations, as well as their shortcomings,
            in particular monitoring implementation of the commitments
            in the Letters of Development Policies. Moreover,
            retrospectively it is clear that it would have been better
            to keep banking supervision, and payments operations in
            separate institutions - as indeed the Bank had advised; it
            would have also been better to start with fewer tariff
            exemptions; and, an earlier focusing on municipal financing
            would have been recommendable.
